posts.title: ABB Internship Interview Experience
posts.description: Finally, Got an Internship in Fortune 500 Company!!
posts.body:
ABB Internship Interview Experience

Finally, Got an Internship in Fortune 500 Company!!

As an international student, it is very hard to secure an internship in the USA. In fact, international student even can't get phone interview so getting a video or in-person interview is a big achievement. In this post, I have written my whole internship hunting experience.

I'm a graduate student at the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee. I enrolled in Fall-2019. In the starting of November 2019, I started to apply for the internship application. Big companies already started to hire interns. I show many student posts about they got the offer for the Summer 2020 internship. I was feeling nervous because I'm getting only online coding challenges. It was a bad time for me.

Created Personal Website

I started wondering about what is wrong in my application. And I figured out it's because I'm on an F-1 visa. Companies are looking for long-term players only and they have to pay extra money for sponsorship. That's the main problem.

I need to do something different than other applications so I thought I should create my portfolio. Many people suggest that resume must be only 1 page. But, I can only put a few information in my resume so a personal website is a good idea to include more project information. So, I created a static website before January 2020.

University Career & Internship Fair

I attended a career fair at my university in the end of February 2020. However, I have applied to more than 200 companies for software development positions before the career fair.

After attending a career fair, I was feeling it is worthless because many companies representative doesn't know anything about the position. They were giving a business card or page and ask me to apply through online by a mentioned website. They were not even interested to take a look at the resume. Many companies do not hire international students, they were looking for US citizens. But, I decided to go to every companies table and leave my resume. If they don't ask for my resume, I insisted them to keep my resume.

Luck?

I was getting many rejection emails and few of them are instant emails after submitting the application. I think that's an auto-generated email where if applicant select as not US citizen, he/she will get an email. One week passed after attending a career fair. Nothing was working out. So, I even stopped to apply for new companies because of frustration.

However, I got some good emails among them. I responded to those emails and scheduled an in-person interview with 2 companies. One of them was ABB(I got an email from ABB on Friday, March 6th). I went to the ABB site in Wisconsin office on Tuesday, March 10th for interview.

The interview went well. I was confident that I will get this job. After 2 days(March 12th), I got a congratulation email from my manager. I was so happy on that day. I like to thanks my manger for trusting me and giving me a chance. Happy ending :)

How did they got my resume?

I did not mention about how I got an in-person interview. As I said earlier, I went to every company table in my university career fair. After one week, ABB's manager emailed me that he got a resume from the HR department and he was looking for an intern to complete one project in the summer. So, the university career fair helped me to get a summer internship in my case even I was thinking career fair is worthless.

Interviewing is a lot about luck, trust me, but the only thing in your hand is practice and perseverance.

I know that was a long post but this is it, my full experience and journey into getting an offer from ABB. I was lucky but prepared. Goodluck with your journey!

posts.title: How to call external Javascript file function from react component
posts.description: Is there any way to call external js file function from inside react component?
posts.body:
Is there any way to call external js file function from inside react component?

The answer is Yes.

Problem Scenario

Case 1: Suppose, you have an index.html file that includes some javascript. Now on your react component, you have a condition that will render only if the condition is true. This means that initially when the page loaded the component has not been rendered yet. When button toggled this is where that component gets rendered. That child component needs to call a javascript method that was included on your external javascript file or inside index.html javascript code. So, how can you do this?

Case 2: Your external javascript function calls when the first time you open the website but when react router changes the component it's not calling that function. I have faced this situation to convert my static website to dynamically. The problem was: there is a jquery function that runs on div tags, class, id events. But, in react the page is never refreshed so jquery runs smoothly first time. After routes change it is not execute the function again. So, data was not displayed on my second page due to jquery animation code.

Solution

Currently, I'm learning the react by own so I have spent many time to find the solution.

Here is the solution. For exaple, you have function inside the index.html file. In that case, you can use componentDidMount function and call that function using window.functionName(). You can check more details about componentDidMount here.

Suppose, you have external javascript file and want to rerun whole code then you have to wrap whole code in one function. Add first and last line from below in your external js file. 

function globalFunction() { 
    //....your whole javascript file code 
}

Overall, componentDidMount function execute the code everytime after it rendered, that's the meaning of the function. There are many soluction you can find about onUpdate event in Router tag or onEnter event in route tag. But, these all are the deprected in the react new version. So, follow this to save your precious time. Please check this post date to verify componentDidMount is not deprecated.

posts.title: The Secret of 100% Commitment and Success is 10 Behaviors
posts.description: The bigger your future, the better your present.
posts.body:
The bigger your future, the better your present.

Today's motivation by Benjamin Hardy

When you have a specific future you are striving for and committed to, your present circumstances and experiences take on a new meaning. You’re able to convert your experience — even your painful experience — into learning, growth, and change. If you don’t have a future you’re actively striving for, then you can’t actively convert your experience into learning.

When you’re committed to a bigger future, your present becomes far less predictable. Rather than living within the confines of your narrow comfort zone, you begin embracing uncertainty. You begin stepping outside of your “known” world and begin approaching the world of your Future Self.

Below skills can achieve incredible things in your life.

1. Define Your Future Self (No More Than 3 Years Out)

Psychologists call active learning “deliberate practice.” You can’t engage in such “practice” or learning unless you have a very clear goal. You need a clear goal and also a clear future identity, as the person you plan to become.

2. Start Getting All of the Information You Possibly Can

Once you’ve defined your own future self, you need to start getting information. You need to develop a clear goal and plan to become your future self.

3. Tell Everyone About Your Plan

It takes courage to be open about your goals. It takes courage to be open about your failings.

Mr. Rogers said: “Anything that’s human is mentionable, and anything that is mentionable can be more manageable. When we can talk about our feelings, they become less overwhelming, less upsetting, and less scary. The people we trust with that important talk can help us know that we are not alone.”

It means that when you become more open and honest as a person, life becomes far more manageable. You stop needlessly suffering internally about unfulfilled dreams or former hurts. You move forward. And that’s the freaking key! Moving forward! That’s where we are about here. Moving forward as powerfully and authentically as possible.

4. Invest at the Level of Your Future Self

Investing in yourself, then, is also about your network of relationships. You are only as good as your network. The more successful you become, the more life becomes about “Who” instead of “How.” The worst thing you could do is trying “going it alone” on your goals. Going it alone is a demonstration of a lack of commitment.

5. Eliminate Everything that Discourages Your Future Self

Stepping out of the comfort zone of your current persona and subconscious is risky. It involves uncertainty and courage. Given this fact, you need the stability and support of encouraging friends and loved ones.

Beyond relationships, you need to remove the information and experiences that are triggering your current and former selves. Zig Ziglar said, “Your input determines your outlook. Your outlook determines your output, and your output determines your future.”

6. Write in Your Journal Every Morning About Your Future Self

There’s a lot going on in your world. Taking 10–20 minutes every day, ideally at the start of the day, to express your thoughts and feelings is how you reduce your internal sufferings and make life manageable.

Writing in your goals every day is essential to optimizing your life. If you want the best possible results, write about your goals and dreams every day. When you’re struggling emotions, write about your emotions. By giving them form, you’ll stop suffering and be enabled to move forward.

Be incredibly honest with yourself.

7. Define 1–3 Actions You Can Make Daily Toward Your Goal

There is a fundamental difference between urgent and important activities. Life is filled with urgencies. But your future self is in the “important” category. Anything that is “important” can easily be procrastinated and put off.

When you’re focused on your future self, you don’t need a big to-do list. Instead, you need a focused and short list. Just 1–3 items each day. Count your wins. Make meaningful progress.

8. “Eat the Frog” Every Single Day

If you’re committed to your dreams, make progress on them before you do anything else. Even if that means you must get up early. If you make progress toward your “important” dreams, you’ll be a better person throughout your day. You’ll be happier in your relationships. You’ll have better energy. You’ll be congruent. You’ll be hopeful and happy. You’ll energize others in a powerful way. You’ll get out of your head with feelings of regret. Thus, you’ll be more present.

If you eat the frog every morning, you will live your dreams.

9. Report Your Progress Daily to Your Accountability Partner (This Takes 1 Minute/Day)

The above picture turns accountability into a single text message each evening. You report how you did on your Big-3(win/out of all) and list your Big-3 for the next day. There’s an added benefit to listing your Big-3 the night before, and that’s that you get to go to bed with a purpose.

By going to bed with a purpose, you can wake up motivated and with a plan. This allows you to avoid needless decision fatigue the next morning.

10. Completely Unplug Every Single Day

Last but not least, you need to fully “unplug” for large intervals throughout your day. There’s a lot of research on Psychological detachment from work. True psychological detachment occurs when you completely refrain from work-related activities and thoughts during non-work time.

Research has shown that only 16 percent of respondents reported getting creative insight while at work. Ideas generally came while the person was at home or in transportation, or during recreational activity(Happens with me most of the time). “The most creative ideas aren’t going to come while sitting in front of your monitor,” says Scott Birnbaum, a vice president of Samsung Semiconductor.

The reason for this is simple. When you’re working directly on a task, your mind is tightly focused on the problem at hand (i.e., direct reflection). Conversely, when you’re not working, your mind loosely wanders (i.e., indirect reflection).

Creativity is a skill you can develop. As is clarity and insight. You’ll get much more when you take time to rest and recover. You need to fully unplug and be actively engaged in other areas of your life.

I wrote this post inspired by Benjamin Hardy's post on Medium. You can check full post here.

Synchronisation Problem

It's not easier to complete the installation of new technology. As you know, developers are keep trying to solve this problem. However, each solution creates the new problem. In react native, you can simply install any new libraries using the npm but there are lots of problem behind this. Developers keep introduces the new features, solve previous bugs, improving architecture etc.

In result, they keep update the versions of the libraries and we have to use latest version of the library. But, when you update only one library then it directly affects the other libraries that depended on it. You will find lots of issues about it in the Github.

Multiple commands produce

posts.title: React AsyncStorage, Redux Guide for Beginners
posts.description: Understanding Redux: How it can be used in React-Native?
posts.body:
Understanding AsyncStorage, Redux: Why and How it can be used in React-Native?

Why Redux?

First, we have to understand why redux is needed in our application. Recently, I completed mobile onboarding application. After that, user moved to the homepage. However, when user refreshed the application; mobile onboarding screens again shown to the user. The purpose of mobile onboarding screen to show main features of the application to the user---This should be one time only--.

AsyncStorage

As you know, react native manages state data component wise and you need to store boolean flag (ex. userOnboardingCompleted?) to create condition on mobile onboarding screens. So, I looked for the local storage and found well known library "AsyncStorage" for react-native. This thing worked for me. Do not use react-native core component for that as it is deprecated in new versions. Follow this tutorial to start with AsyncStorage and trust me it is very easy part.

Redux

Now, I want to use apiToken in every component. You might be thinking: it is easy to get values from the local storage using AsyncStorage getItem function. But, it is bad designing because everytime your application fetch value from the storage so it takes much time to render new pages.

This time redux come into the picture. Redux is a state manager. In other way, it is state management libraries beautifully keep logic and behaviours abstracted away from the UI. So, your application reads local storage data one time and stores it into the memory using state. Now, redux passes this data to every component so it will save lot of time.

Challenges

Learning redux is quite difficult as you have to learn many new things. When I approached Redux for the first time today I was confused. There is too much terminology: action, reducer, middleware. But on top of that it wasn't clear to me how were all the moving parts glued together? There were some minions or what? In Redux there are no minions (unfortunately).

Solution

However, it is not that hard if you follow this tutorial completely.

1) https://css-tricks.com/understanding-how-reducers-are-used-in-redux/

2) #1 WTF is Redux? | React Native App | Redux Tutorial

posts.title: How to persist Redux State to the Local Storage?
posts.description: Time saver library to manage redux state data locally.
posts.body:
Time saver library to manage redux state data locally.

Redux is a great library which solves many issues related to keeping a state of an application. Thanks to it, we no longer have to worry about the hierarchy of components. The central store can be accessed from every component to get the current state of any aspect of an application.

Local Storage

However, sometimes you may need to store redux state data locally. For ex, storing user profile name, user name can be used multiple components. As per current understanding, you will read and write profile name from local storage--AsyncStorage--.

Redux-Persist

But, you can do this using redux persist library. Redux-persist is a simple library; it’s a wrapper for a store that automatically saves a redux state to the storage. Also, you can define where it should save data, and available options depend on a platform; you can choose localStorage, sessionStorage, localForage, AsyncStorage or we can even integrate it with the custom storage. In future, if you want to change local storage then you have to change in only one file.

There are many configuration you can give to the library and it makes your life very easy. Suppose, you don't want to store every data in the local storage. So, there is a option to provide whitelist and blacklist components. Blacklist components navigation will not be persisted--oppose to whitelist--.

Tutorial

If you think, it is useful in your application. You can follow below tutorials to get complete understanding about redux persist.

posts.title: Hosting react blog to Github Pages
posts.description: How to deploy React App to GitHub Pages?
posts.body:
How to deploy React App to GitHub Pages?

Recently, I have converted my static website to dynamic using react. Now, it's time to host it on Github Pages. You might know what is Github Pages so you can skip next paragraph.

Github Pages

Github is a company that hosts "code repositories", collections of code for projects. Many of the code repositories are "open source", which means they're publicly available for the whole world to browse. Well, Github has a feature called Github Pages, which makes it easy and free for you to create a multi-file website hosted at yourusername.github.io.

I already hosted my static website on the Github pages so I just have to change the repository. If you want to host your react app from the scratch you can follow this latest tutorial.

Copying branch from one repository to another, preserving git history

In the multi-repository project structure, its only a matter of time when you’ll want to refactor some files from one project to another. I was maintaining my static website on one repository and created new react app in new repository. Now, I have to copy all previous branches to new branches as it doesn't worth to leave old repository. However, it can be useful in future so it's good idea to take backup.

Copying branches from another repository is quite easy task. You just have to follow below steps.

Repository url

  origin: https://github.com/kepy97/portfolio.git #::Your original repository 
 remote: https://github.com/kepy97/old_portfolio.git #::Repository that you want to copy branches

Copy all branch from another repository

$ git clone https://github.com/kepy97/portfolio.git #::clone origin repo 
$ cd git-test
$ git remote add old_repo https://github.com/kepy97/old_portfolio.git #::add as a remote branch

show all remote repo

  $ git remote -v 
 html5 https://github.com/kepy97/old_portfolio.git (fetch) 
 html5 https://github.com/kepy97/old_portfolio.git (push) 
 origin https://github.com/kepy97/portfolio.git (fetch) 
 origin https://github.com/kepy97/portfolio.git (push)

fetch remote repo data and show branches

  $ git fetch html5 
 $ git branch -a 
 * master 
 remotes/old_repo/master 
 remotes/old_repo/blog 
 remotes/origin/HEAD 
 remotes/origin/master

Copy old_repo/blog branch to origin repository

  $ git checkout -b old_site_blog old_repo/blog
old_site_blog = "New branch name in original repo" old_repo/blog = "the branch name that you want to copy"

push old_site_blog to origin server

  $ git push origin old_site_blog

Now, you can see all your old_repo_blog copied into origin branch online. If you want to copy another branch then follow last two steps again.

Many of you might want to use Custom Domain in react app

To use custom domain, you have to setup github repository and change your DNS to github servers. You can follow this pretty forward tutorial here.

However, when you setup for react application you have to provide CNAME in github repository. But, when you run npm run deploy command, it overrides/delete the CNAME file. So, everytime you have to update the CNAME online. There's a open issue on github gh-pages -d dist overwrites custom domain

There's a solution for automatic CNAME changes. You just have to add CNAME file in /public directory. create-react-app will include all /public directory files in the build output.

Hope this tutorial helped you! Happy coding!!!!!

posts.title: How to run android emulator without opening Android Studio?
posts.description: Start the emulator from the command line
posts.body:
Start the emulator from the command line in MAC OS

I'm developing mobile application in react-native. Manytimes I want to test my application in android device. It's very hard to test application by building apk and run on physical device. If you are developing application in react-native or any cross platform, you might want to run application on iOS as well android device.

It's easy to test application in ios emulator because react-native run-ios can directly opens the emulator in MAC OS. However, react-native run-android command can't open android emulator. You have to open android studio to start the emulator.

Solution

You can start the emulator using command line. Firsly, your system have installed android studio. Then, go to the android sdk folder. Default installation path in MAC os is: 

  /Users/yoursystemname/Library/Android/sdk/emulator

Change your system name in above path. After that, 

  emulator -list-avds
OR 
  ./emulator -list-avds

Then copy the avd_name that you want to start. After that run following command: 

  emulator @avd_name
OR 
  ./emulator @avd_name

Now, your emulator will start. Many people find this problem:"PANIC: Missing emulator engine program for 'x86' CPUS." In that case, you just have to go to the emulator directory instead of toools. If you face any problem then check above screenshot for more details.

posts.body:
How to Scroll to a List Item in React?

A brief tutorial which shows you use cases on how to scroll to an item within a list of items in a React List Component. Also, this tutorial shows smooth scrolling. Smooth scrolling is when instead of clicking on a button and being instantly taken to a different part of the same page, the user is navigated there via a scroll animation. It’s one of those subtle UI features on a site that makes an aesthetic difference.

There are many tutorials you can see on the internet. But, most of the solutions are not working or you face somekind of the warning or error. That's because of the many functionality deprecated in latest react versions. I will show you latest method to smooth scroll in your website(Still, please check latest method on react official website to check this method does not deprecated(May 2020)).

Let's jump into the solution

Create global variable in your component.

Now use ref variable in your tag that you wanted to focus after scrolling.

How iPhone takes picture?

Language Selection

When a programming language decision must be made, programs should conduct a trade study to determine the best computer programming language, or mix of programming languages, to be used to satisfy system life cycle requirements. Each programming language has their own benefits but choosing the right programming language saves a lot of time. How?

  • Easiness of maintaining the code
  • Faster performance
  • Reuse --- You can use existing library/packages to complete task
  • Support --- If technology is well known so you can get lot of support and bug solution from the internet
  • Extent of compatibility with and impact of other related direction

To make a data-centric web app from the bottom-up, it is advantageous to plan below things:

  • Web front end (HTML, CSS, Javascript) - for the look and feel of your web app
  • Backend language (e.g. Node.js, Python, Ruby) - control how your web app works
  • Database (Oracle, PostgreSQL) - to store the data of the application
  • DevOps (Github, Jenkins) - Deploying / hosting your web app

Frontend technology

User experience is the number one priority for every business in the market today. As a developer, even the brief you get on your project talks about the simplicity of the user interface it is supposed to feature. No matter how complex functions and operations happen in the background, what users see and experience has to be seamless.

Best Frontend Framework 2020

I choose React over all other frameworks in the market. There were multiple reasons behind this but one of the main thing is popularity.

Talking about the relative popularity of each framework, the below graph shows the overall usage popularity of each framework listed for best frontend frameworks in 2020. We can see that after the year 2015-16, Angular and React have been in huge demand.

Also, One of the simplest frameworks to learn – React – was developed at Facebook to fix code maintainability issues due to the constant addition of features in the app. An open-source framework now, React stands out because of its virtual Document Object Model (DOM), which offers its exceptional functionality. An ideal framework for those who anticipate high traffic and need a stable platform to handle it.

Backend language

The backend programming language is also known as server side programming. The name given to all types of programs which run on the web server. They process the user input, interact with the databases and control what content is served back to the client as a response to his request. It is written in a number of programming languages including PHP, NodeJS, Python, etc and has full access to the server’s OS and the programmer can chose the language he/she wants to code in.

I'm confused to choose between Node.js Express and Python Flask language.

Flask is easy enough for developer to pick up and build something over a weekend. It's extremely easy to getting start with it. Also, performance of the python language is always great.

Database

I choose PostgreSQL database to store the data for our application. I have an option to choose NoSQL database but our application have certain limits so I went for RDMS. Also, postgre is an Enterprise-class relational database system. It is easy to setup and installs. It offers support for SQL and NoSQL. It has a great community which happy to serve you when you are facing issues while using PostgreSQL.

DevOps

posts.description: Important rules to keep in mind when designing the database.
posts.body:
Database Designing

After selecting web technologies and database, I'm moving forward to designing the database for my project. I read many articles regarding database design. So, I want to list out few important rules that are different from the common rules.

1) Nature of the application (OLTP or OLAP)

When you start your database design the first thing to analyze is the nature of the application you are designing for, is it Transactional or Analytical.

Transactional: In this kind of application, your end user is more interested in CRUD, i.e., creating, reading, updating, and deleting records. The official name for such a kind of database is OLTP.

Analytical: In these kinds of applications your end user is more interested in analysis, reporting, forecasting, etc. These kinds of databases have a less number of inserts and updates. The main intention here is to fetch and analyze data as fast as possible. The official name for such a kind of database is OLAP.

In other words if you think inserts, updates, and deletes are more prominent then go for a normalized table design, else create a flat denormalized database structure. Follow this: Normalization of Database

2) Naming Convention

A naming convention is an important part of a well-built data model. Look at the database model below. The model is not very fun to look at, to try to understand, or to code around.

Let’s start with some things that you should consider if you need to create a new naming convention. You want to give name that follows across the whole database.

The case of the name. You can choose between:

  • UPPERCASE names - All name in uppercase
  • lowercase names - All name in lowercase
  • camelCase names – the name starts with a lowercase letter, but new words start with an uppercase letter
  • PascalCaseNames (also known as upper camel) – similar to camelCase, but the name starts with an uppercase letter, as do all additional words
  • Underscore - you can separate them with an underscore (like_this)

3) Data types

We deal with different types of data such as strings, characters, whole numbers (integers), and decimal numbers (floating point numbers). Similarly, when we write a computer program to process different types of data, we need to specify its type clearly.

PostgreSQL supports many data types. Here, I list out few points to choose data type:

  • Choose BIGINT for primary ID. Many developer face issues to convert INTEGER to BIGINT later on.
  • Store all timestamps using UTC.
  • Always use a library to perform date and time math.
  • Use a standard time offset.

4) Break data into logical pieces

This rule is actually the first rule from 1st normal form. Better approach would be to break table field into further logical pieces so that we can write clean and optimal queries.

However, I want to add here. "Break data into logical pieces but don't overdose it"

Developers are cute creatures. If you tell them this is the way, they keep doing it; well, they overdo it leading to unwanted consequences. For example: you can see the phone number field; it’s rare that you will operate on ISD codes of phone numbers separately (until your application demands it). So it would be a wise decision to just leave it as it can lead to more complications.

PostgreSQL supports many data types. Here, I list out few points to choose data type:

  • Choose BIGINT for primary ID. Many developer face issues to convert INTEGER to BIGINT later on.
  • Store all timestamps using UTC.
  • Always use a library to perform date and time math.
  • Use a standard time offset.

Many companies are using proxy server to improve corporate and institutional security. Also, it reduces the chances of a breach. Proxy servers add an additional layer of security between the servers and outside traffic. However, this feature creates problem in install the npm packages. NPM stucked while installing the library with error: "rollbackFailedOptional: verb npm-session 10d5b2a946ddf605".

As you can see in the above screenshot, I was trying to install moment js library through 

npm install moment

Initially, I have no idea about what's the problem so I was checking my internet connection, laptop admin rights etc. Everything was good --I have good internet connection--I can install applications in latop. Then, I reached to our network guy and he gave me another wireless network password. After that, I was able to install the npm packages because that connection is not behind the proxy.

However, that was not the permanent solution. As I'm building application from scratch, I keep need to try best npm packages to build robust application. When I was switching to the wireless connection, SSO(Single Sign-on was not working. Finally, I found the permanent solution after looking more into it.

Solution (NPM config proxy setting)

1) First of all, you have to setup the proxy url in npm config. You can get the url from your network guy. Also, many of you can find the proxy.pac file by searching into Windows search -> Proxy Setting. Find below script address and download it. Now, take a look at the downloaded script you will find server name as URL:port. If you get multiple server names, choose common url.

Now you have the server name. But, you also need your laptop username(domain\username) and password to set the proxy. Then, follow below commands in widnows command prompt: 

  • npm config get proxy
    (You will get null first) 
  • npm config set proxy "http://domain%5Cusername:password@servername:port/"
    (Change 3 values: computer username, password, servername:port) 
  • npm config get proxy
    (Verify, it is properly configured)

One thing to keep in mind that, you need to encode the special characters in username and password. You can use this website to encode the username and password: url-encode-decode

Try to install the package, hopefully you can install it. However, if you got something certificate problem then you have one more command need to run.

SSO(Single Sign ON)

Nowadays, SSO(Single Sign ON) is used by big tech companies. If you have multiple portals for different users, you should definitely go for the SSO. As a user, he/she didn't have to remember different passwords. Also, they don't have to login multiple times. You can choose a different service provider for your project like Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure etc.

Open Authentication(OAuth)

If you want to integrate third-party authentication like Login via Facebook or Google or Linkedin or Github or any other specific site, you have to go for Open Authentication(OAuth). OAuth is a protocol that allows an application to authenticate against server as a user. The recommendation is to implement OAuth 1.0a or OAuth 2.0. OAuth 2.0 relies on HTTPS for security and it currently implemented by Google, Facebook, Twitter etc.

Token-Based authentication

If you have only one portal, you can opt for the token-based authentication. JSON web tokens are mostly used. You can easily find the library or package in any popular programming language. So, you don't have to write code for generating or verifying the tokens. I'm gonna use this method. I found the popular library for Python Flask Project: Flask JWT Extended

SQLAlchemy: tips for flask database connection

I have done pretty good progress on creating APIs using Python Flask web-framework. As we require a database to store the different types of data. Nowadays, we can use ORM (Object-relational mapping) technique to communicate with the database.

What is ORM?

If you don't know what is ORM refer to this article for more detail: What is an ORM and Why You Should Use it. Here's the short description: Object-relational-mapping is the idea of being able to write queries, even complicated ones, using the object-oriented paradigm of your preferred programming language.

How to use ORM in Python?

In python, you can use SQLAlchemy library. SQLAlchemy is a popular SQL toolkit and Object Relational Mapper. It gives full power and flexibility of SQL to an application developer and using that which classes can be mapped to the database.

Can we use it in Flask web-framework?

Yes, Of course. Also, there's a Flask library (Flask-SQLAlchemy) which is an extension for Flask that adds support for SQLAlchemy to the application. So, SQLAlchemy is much simpler to use in Flask.

Before you start using it, you need to understand some basic topics to work with Flask-SQLAlchemy.

  • Data Models:

    This is the important concept of ORM to start working with it. You need to understand how to define your database models in your program.

  • Relationships

    In a larger application, there must be multiple relationships in the database design. So, you have to tell your program that these tables are connected with each other.

  • Relationship links

    To connect different database fields, you need to specify links between them in the program. There are two concept in backref and back_populate in SQLAlchemy. back_populates informs each relationship about the other so that they are kept in sync. So, you need to use in Parent and child class as well. If you use backref, it needs to go on one of them only.

  • Join Type

    After defining the relationships between your data models, you need to specify how to join them when getting the data from those models. There are multiple types of joining in SQLAlchemy like: select, dynamic, joined, subquery etc. Each of those have different meanins, you have to figure out how do you need your data.

The above four concepts are really really important before you start using the SQLAlchemy. I'm providing the best tutorials to helps you understand those concepts faster.

Analysis paralysis

In software development, analysis paralysis typically manifests itself through the Waterfall model with exceedingly long phases of project planning, requirements gathering, program design and data modeling, which can create little or no extra value by those steps and risk many revisions -- wiki.

You need to careful about it. As many software developer faces this problem. Even I think I was doing overthinking when I was creating backend structure(Python Flask Project Structure). It took so much effort. But, sometime overthinking does not help.

posts.body:
Performance Improvement in Project

Recently, I got some time from the developing the project. So, I thought let's take a look to improve the performance of the project.

How to improve?

There are several ways improve the performance. Like? You can start first from cleaning up code, removing unnecessary imports in the file, deleting not needed files. Also, you can reorganize your project structure by dividing into multiple components.

Above are the very basic things that you can do in your project. After that, you can take a look at your application main section which is used many times when user open the application. This is the section which executes several times. It can be homepage of your application. If there's multiple loops are running, try to remove that first.

Loops?

Yes, loops like for, while are downgrade your application performance. You can move that loop code from backend to front-end or get specific formatted data from the database. Always, try to avoid using loops in the backend except there's not any other way.

What next?

By following above steps, your application will be significantly improved. Now, you can focus on database part.

In software application, there are major performance based on backend, and it continuously interacts with the database. You must be using ORM in backend to get the data. You can find many guidelines about how to improve performace in your ORM library. I'm using SQLAlchemy in python flask framework.

I found pretty good article about Master SQLAlchemy Relationships in a Performance Friendly Way. If you can't find anything there are some basic rules that you can avoid like:

  • Retrieving an entire result set when only the count is needed
  • Retrieving entire models when only a few columns are needed
  • Updating one object at a time inside a loop
  • Triggering cascading deletes
  • Using the ORM for a bulk record import
  • Calling commit or flush multiple times

I've followed above all rules in my project. Now, performance is drastically changed. I hope this list of common pitfalls can help you avoid these issues and keep your application running smoothly. As always, when diagnosing a performance problem, measurement is key. Most databases offer performance diagnostics that can help you pinpoint issues, such as the PostgreSQL pg_stat_statements module.

Why I changed Github Pages to Netlify Hosting Platform?

Today, I changed this blog hosting from Github pages to Netlify plateform

Earlier, I wrote the tutorial about How to deploy React App to GitHub Pages? The hosting platform of Github is awesome. It was easy to host. They have integrated continuous deployment so no need to change files on the server. When I commit to my branch it is directly deployed.

What is the reason to change?

The reason behind the changing plateform is SEO of my blog. I wanted to index my blog pages in search engine sites. You can find the tutorial on my blog about React is SEO friendly or not.

Above post was about 3 months ago. Since then, I have been trying to index my pages on Google. But, there was no luck. I'm getting only two results of my website.

React was not a problem

Turns out, react was not a problem at all. So, whose problem it is. I can say that this problem is a combination of Github Pages and my programming (LOL) and Google crawlers. Yeah, that's true. Let me explain it in more detail.

1) Github Pages

When I hosted my first blog on Github Pages, I face the problem of 404 when I refresh the blog page. It can't find the index.html file on the server on that route. You can find more detail here: SPA host on Github.

2) Programming

However, I found the easy solution that we can use HashRouter to generate the links. I changed the code according to that. So, URLs will change from http://www.kepy.online/blog/surviving-finals-week to http://www.kepy.online/#/blog/surviving-finals-week.

3) Google crawlers

I didn't have the problem with hash-based URL. But, Google can't index those URLs. I got to know after I posted a question on google webmaster community. Question: URL can be indexed: Still many pages not showing in Google

Solution

As you can see, the problem generated due to multiple factors. I came up with a different solution like I can use query string as URL to find the specific route. But, I was looking for a permanent solution. Then, I got to know about Netlify.

Netlify is an all-in-one platform for automating modern web projects. It is very easy to deploy react website on Netlify. Also, it has a free plan and solves 404 Github pages error using "_redirects" file. Follow this tutorial to host on Netlify.

Now, everyone is happy. I hope google to index my pages in a few days. Wish me luck :)
